comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: This is likely the home of John Hayes Hammond (portrait). The 1910-1915 D.C. city directories list him as having two different addresses during those years, 1500 Rhode Island Ave., NW and 2315 Massachusetts Ave., NW (the latter since demolished, the former still standing but renovated beyond recognition, now occupied by the National Paint and Coatings Association).

comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: Having looked at a few photos, I'm thinking this is likely 1500 Rhode Island Avenue, NW - Robert Bruce reports in Alexander Graham Bell and the Conquest of Solitude that John Hayes Hammond rented 1500 at one point. Are you aiming to develop standards/controlled vocabulary for tagging these images, or just to let Flickr users free tag them?

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I think it's a free for all

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In 1911, J. H. Hammond was appointed Special Ambassador to Britain for the coronation of George V. He traveled to England and attended the ceremony in Westminster Abbey.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See also (in Bain upload sequence with late 1914 images)
